title: Acceleration graph of SHM from position graph

content.question: A block is hung vertically from an ideal spring. The block is pulled down and allowed to oscillate. The position y as a function for time t is shown in the graph above. Which of the following graphs best represents the acceleration a of the block as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure presents a wave curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled a. The curve begins above the horizontal t axis, and to the left of the vertical a axis. It extends downward and to the right, crossing the t axis to the left of the origin, and crossing the a axis below the origin. It reaches a minimum shortly after crossing the a axis, then extends upward and to the right, crossing the t axis to the right of the origin. It continues upward, reaches a maximum, then turns back downward again, crossing the t axis, and reaching a minimum before turning back upward. This is the stem graph flipped vertically.

The figure presents a wave curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled a. The curve begins above the horizontal t axis, and to the left of the vertical a axis. It extends downward and to the right, crossing the t axis to the left of the origin, then reaches a minimum to the left of the a axis. It then extends upward and to the right, crossing the t axis just to the left of the origin. It continues upward, crossing the a axis above the origin, and reaches a maximum high above the t axis and just to the right of the a axis. It then turns back downward again, crossing the t axis, and reaching a minmum before turning back upward and reaching a maximum above the t axis. This pattern continues two more times. This graph is the stem graph flipped vertically and with two waves occurring for every single wave in the stem graph.

The figure presents a wave curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled a. The curve begins below the horizontal t axis, and to the left of the vertical a axis. It extends upward and to the right, crossing the t axis to the left of the origin, then reaches a maximum just to the left of the a axis. It then extends downward and to the right, crossing the a axis far above the origin, and continues downward. It crosses the t axis, then reaches a minimum far below the t axis and to the right of the a axis. It then turns back upward again, crossing the t axis, and reaching a maximum before turning back downward and reaching a minimum below the t axis. This graph is the stem graph shifted slightly to the left.

The figure presents a wave curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled a. The curve begins below the horizontal t axis, and to the left of the vertical a axis. It extends upward and to the right, crossing the t axis to the left of the origin, and crossing the a axis above the origin. It reaches a maximum, then extends downward and to the right, crossing the t axis to the right of the origin. It continues downward, reaches a minimum, then turns back upward again, crossing the t axis, and reaching a maximum before turning back downward. This curve has the same shape as in the stem graph.
